answers.answer: Scheduled c sections usually happen because they have a medical condition that requires a c section, or they had previous emergency c sections in past births and do not want to do vbac. Elective c sections, or a section without any medical cause are rare. A lot of doctors don't want to do elective c sections.

Well most of the time women have scheduled cesareans bc they have medical. Conditions like preeclampsia or gestational diabetes etc. Other times times it is bc their first pregnancy ended in a csection for one reason or another so they automatically get a scheduled one thereafter. Thankfully thigh my first pregnancy ended in a csection I am having a vbac vaginal birth after cesarean. Some women don't have this option bc they either are not a good candidate for it or live in an area where surrounding hospitals don't do then a lot of county hospitals will not do a vbac.
